page.title: 13Gravel Proposal, Bridgham
page.content:
In Spring l985, Bridgham's peaceful existence was shaken by notification of the biggest threat ever to have challenged its rural, undisturbed way of life. Atlas Aggregates applied to Norfolk County Council for planning permission to extract sand and gravel from a 50 acre site over a period of 15+ years. The site (Stonehouse Farm) lies within East Harling parish to our east. However, the land lies in much closer proximity to Bridgham, running along the southern side of the River Thet; our houses lie to the north of the river.
Stonehouse Farm had previously belonged to the Forestry Commision who, under government pressure to sell less profitable acres, sold the land to Atlas Aggregates for a large sum.
